name: Mr.Cat.
upgrade_notice: IMPORTANT: This release has base changes to the code. Before updating do a backup of your site and annotate your selections on MR Categories. After the update you might need to re-select your widgets' options.
author: Marcos Rego

sections.description:
Mr.Cat. brings you the widget 'MR Categories'. Display categories with descriptions, media and links, in a variety of layouts with many customizable options.

MR Categories
Some content display plugins and CMS do not highlight categories as much as posts. But that could be practicle for a better organization, structure, search engine optimization and a better understanding of the front and backoffice from clients and users.

'MR Categories' makes it easier and faster to display categories and have your websites structured in ways such as:

Page with categories > Category page with posts > Post
sections.changelog:
0.5.0

New features:

  • Items image options using background

Corrected bugs:

  • The 'reveal active' option (used in layouts such as 'Collapsible') was opening the content step by step.
  • The Custom layout direction toggle should only be sideways with the options: 'expand active', 'When active hide inactives' or 'Only show subcategories of active'.
  • In portrait mode the 'expand active' option (used in layouts such as 'Accordion') sometimes showed an horizontal scroll on bigger width items.
  • The 'Menu' layout of the 'Default' theme was confusing when subcategories were on a different page, for this reason this layout now forces the number of items per page to be infinite.
  • On the browsers IE and Edge in landscape mode, the 'expand active' option (used in layouts such as 'Accordion') was shrinking the content to fit the visible space on inactive items.
  • On the backend the list of items sometimes was not divided into pages, this made the manual order seem wrong but it was correct on the frontend.
  • Removed borders from the page toggles 'arrows' when style is enabled.
  • The options 'use landscape' and 'use portrait' together with the 'expand active' on the 'Custom' layout, were not working very well and got some revision.

Improvements

Around 15 improvements were made, including adjusting the admin style following the changes made to Wordpress 5.3. If you want to know more improvements see the direct project on Github here.

See the full changelog on Github.
